public ref class DSACng sealed : System::Security::Cryptography::DSA

Docs.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA).
Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random 2,048-bit key pair.

MemberSignature.Value: public DSACng (int keySize);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 keySize) cil managed
Public Sub New (keySize As Integer)
new System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng : int -> System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng
public: DSACng(int keySize);

Docs.param: The size of the key to generate in bits.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a randomly generated key of the specified size.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Valid key sizes range from 512 to 3,072 bits, in increments of 64. We recommend that a minimum size of 2,048 bits be used for all keys.
> [!IMPORTANT] > The creators of the DSA algorithm have withdrawn their support for it. Consider using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSA> class or the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> class instead of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DSA> class. Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DSA> only for compatibility with legacy applications and data.

public: DSACng(System::Security::Cryptography::CngKey ^ key);

Docs.param: The key to use for DSA operations.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.AlgorithmGroup%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> of `key` must be <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithmGroup.Dsa%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
This constructor creates a copy of the key. Even if `key` is disposed, the copy of this key object in DSA remains alive.

Docs.exception: is not a valid DSA key.

Docs.param: The bytes to use as a password when decrypting the key material.
The bytes of a PKCS#8 EncryptedPrivateKeyInfo structure in the ASN.1-BER encoding.
When this method returns, contains a value that indicates the number of bytes read from . This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Imports the public/private keypair from a PKCS#8 EncryptedPrivateKeyInfo structure after decrypting with a byte-based password, replacing the keys for this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey Key { get; }
.property instance class System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey Key
Public ReadOnly Property Key As CngKey
member this.Key : System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey
public: property System::Security::Cryptography::CngKey ^ Key { System::Security::Cryptography::CngKey ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key that will be used by the object for any cryptographic operation that it performs.
Docs.value: The key used by the object to perform cryptographic operations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object is disposed if the key is reset, for instance by changing the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.KeySize%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, by using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.ImportParameters%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to create a new key, or by disposing the parent <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng> object. Therefore, you should ensure that the key object is no longer used in these cases.
This <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object is not the same as the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object passed to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.DSACng.%23ctor%2A> constructor, if that constructor was used. However, it will point to the same CNG key.
